delete.summary:
Deletes an asset.
Note: this does not prevent asset from being found again.
Deleting an asset has cooling down period of 48 hours, after that it can be rediscovered again. (Team Permissions: [assets:write])

parameters.description: An identifier of the asset to be deleted

values.description: Asset values that should trigger the automation.

hostValues.description: Asset host values that should trigger the automation.

oneOf.description: View model for asset found trigger.

riskTypes.description:
Array of risk types that should trigger the automation. If null, all risk types will be considered.
Risk types can be Verified, Potential, UnpatchedTechnology, or InfectedDevice.

translationKey.description: Key used to define risk category translation.

items.description: View model for a risk category

riskCategories.description:
Array of risk categories that should trigger the automation. If null, all risk categories will be considered.
These categories correspond to the categories that risks are assigned to in the system.

items.description:
Defines the characteristics that can be used to filter risks in automation triggers.
These characteristics represent specific attributes of risks that can be used to determine
when an automation should be triggered.

characteristics.description:
Array of risk characteristics that should trigger the automation. These characteristics define specific attributes
of the risks that should be matched for the trigger to activate, such as whether a patch is available,
if there is an exploit, or if it's being actively exploited.

items.description: View model for an asset tag

tags.description:
Array of tags that should be associated with the risks to trigger the automation. If null, tags will not be considered
in the trigger conditions.

post.summary:
Creates a new organization as subsidiary of the specified organization.
The user making the call will be added as owner to the new organization.
Note that the `{organizationId}` in the url is required for the `[RequireOrganizationPermission]`
to work (the permission service needs to add organization permissions based on the
organization specified by the route id). We don't actually need to retrieve it from the url. (Organization Permissions: [organizations:create])

not of the actual resource that was shared).

post.summary: Triggers all scans for a module and/or organization to run a soon as possible while respecting rate limits.
